column2: PKF Finance Limited is looking for  Realization Officerto join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     The Realization Officer plays a key role in ensuring that organizational goals and strategies are effectively implemented and achieved      This position involves collaborating with various departments, analyzing data, and monitoring progress to ensure that the envisioned outcomes are realized          Responsibilities:          Strategic Implementation:Work closely with senior management to understand organizational goals and strategies      Develop detailed implementation plans to execute the strategic vision      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and understanding of objectives      Performance Monitoring:Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure progress toward goals      Regularly monitor and analyze data to assess the effectiveness of implemented strategies      Identify areas for improvement and recommend corrective actions      Stakeholder Communication:Communicate progress and updates to internal and external stakeholders      Collaborate with communication teams to ensure consistent messaging      Address inquiries and concerns related to the realization of organizational objectives      Risk Management:Identify potential risks and obstacles to the realization of goals      Develop contingency plans to mitigate risks and address unforeseen challenges      Work proactively to prevent and address issues that may hinder progress      Documentation and Reporting:Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation related to the implementation of strategies      Prepare regular reports for management, summarizing achievements, challenges, and recommendations      Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards

column2: Hikal Ltd is looking for Officer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Operational Management: Oversee day-to-day operations within their area of responsibility, ensuring efficiency, productivity, and adherence to organizational goals and standards.      Project Coordination: Lead and coordinate projects, initiatives, or tasks assigned to their department or team. Develop project plans, timelines, and budgets, and ensure successful project execution.      Team Leadership: Provide leadership, guidance, and mentorship to team members, fostering a positive work environment, encouraging professional growth, and promoting teamwork and collaboration.      Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement, optimization, and streamlining of workflows. Implement changes, best practices, and efficiency measures to enhance operational effectiveness.      Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, including colleagues, clients, vendors, and partners, to achieve shared objectives, address challenges, and foster positive relationships.      Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyze data, metrics, and key performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to their area of responsibility. Prepare reports, presentations, and dashboards to communicate insights, trends, and recommendations to management and stakeholders.      Problem Solving and Decision Making: Identify issues, challenges, and obstacles hindering progress or performance. Develop solutions, make informed decisions, and take proactive steps to address issues and achieve desired outcomes.      Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, policies, and standards governing their area of operation. Identify and mitigate risks, vulnerabilities, and compliance gaps through effective risk management practices.      Customer Relationship Management: Maintain positive relationships with customers, clients, or end-users of products or services offered by their department or organization. Address customer inquiries, feedback, and concerns in a timely and satisfactory manner.

column2: Plumbing System Management:        Oversee the maintenance, repair, and installation of plumbing systems, fixtures, and equipment throughout the organization, including water supply lines, drainage systems, sewage lines, and plumbing fixtures.      Ensure the proper functioning and integrity of plumbing systems, including water heaters, pumps, valves, faucets, toilets, sinks, and showers.        Project Coordination:          Coordinate plumbing projects, renovations, and upgrades, including planning, budgeting, scheduling, and procurement of materials and equipment.      Collaborate with contractors, vendors, and other stakeholders to ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and in accordance with specifications and quality standards.            Compliance and Regulation:          Ensure compliance with local building codes, plumbing regulations, and safety standards in all plumbing activities and installations.      Obtain necessary permits and approvals for plumbing projects and ensure inspections are conducted as required by regulatory authorities.            Troubleshooting and Repairs:          Respond to plumbing emergencies, service calls, and maintenance requests in a timely manner, troubleshooting issues and performing repairs as needed to minimize disruptions and ensure continuity of operations.      Diagnose and resolve problems with leaks, clogs, low water pressure, and other plumbing issues, utilizing appropriate tools and techniques.            Preventive Maintenance:        Develop and implement preventive maintenance programs for plumbing systems and equipment, including routine inspections, cleaning, lubrication, and replacement of worn parts to prevent breakdowns and prolong equipment lifespan.      Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, equipment inspections, repairs, and replacements for compliance and reporting purposes.        Training and Education:        Provide training and guidance to maintenance staff and other employees on proper plumbing practices, safety procedures, and use of plumbing tools and equipment.      Promote awareness of water conservation practices and initiatives to reduce water usage and promote sustainability.        Budget Management:        Assist in the development and management of the plumbing department budget, including forecasting expenses, tracking expenditures, and identifying cost-saving opportunities.      Evaluate vendor proposals, negotiate contracts, and ensure cost-effective procurement of materials and services.

column2: Accomplish the Assigned Bench Work        -> Perform laboratory experiments and tasks in accordance with the projects requirements.    -> Adhere to standard operating procedures (SOPs) to ensure consistency and accuracy in all experiments.    .-> Ensure that all bench work is conducted in a safe and organized manner.        Develop Experiment Plans & Generate QC Reports:        ->Develop detailed experiment plans, outlining the objectives, methods, and expected outcomes of each experiment.    -> Execute experiments as per the defined plans, meticulously recording all relevant data and observations.    -> Generate comprehensive Quality Control (QC) reports summarizing the results, data analysis, and any deviations from expected outcomes.    ->Submit the QC reports to the client or relevant stakeholders in a timely manner.        Track Usage of Materials and Raise Purchase Requests        -> Maintain an inventory of laboratory materials, reagents, and supplies.    -> Monitor the consumption of materials and reagents during experiments.    -> Identify and anticipate when supplies are running low, and initiate the procurement process by raising Purchase Requests (PRs).    -> Ensure that all purchases are in compliance with budgetary constraints and quality standards.        Adhere to Quality Control Requirements:        -> Strictly adhere to established Quality Control (QC) and Quality Assurance (QA) protocols.    -> Regularly calibrate and maintain laboratory equipment to ensure accuracy and reliability.    -> Follow Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), as applicable.      Report any deviations from SOPs or quality control standards, and work collaboratively to implement corrective and preventive actions. In this role, attention to detail, precision, and a commitment to maintaining high- quality standards are crucial. Laboratory technicians or research associates play a vital role in generating reliable and accurate data for research and development projects. They should also be excellent communicators, as they often need to share findings with clients and other stakeholders.
